Milcery (Japanese: マホミル Mahomil) is a Fairy-type Pokémon introduced in Generation VIII.

It evolves into Alcremie while holding a Sweet when the player spins and strikes a pose or gets dizzy. The form it evolves into depends on the time of day, the length of the spin, and whether the Trainer was spinning clockwise or counterclockwise. Its appearance is further determined by the type of Sweet that is held.

Milcery evolves into:

  • Vanilla Cream Alcremie after spinning clockwise for less than 5 seconds during the day.
  • Ruby Cream Alcremie after spinning counterclockwise for less than 5 seconds during the day.
  • Matcha Cream Alcremie after spinning clockwise for less than 5 seconds at night.
  • Mint Cream Alcremie after spinning counterclockwise for more than 5 seconds at night.
  • Lemon Cream Alcremie after spinning clockwise for more than 5 seconds at night.
  • Salted Cream Alcremie after spinning counterclockwise for less than 5 seconds at night.
  • Ruby Swirl Alcremie after spinning counterclockwise for more than 5 seconds during the day.
  • Caramel Swirl Alcremie after spinning clockwise for more than 5 seconds during the day.
  • Rainbow Swirl Alcremie after spinning in either direction for more than 10 seconds during the evening.

(Refer to Game data→Evolution data for more details.)

Biology

Milcery is a small cream-colored Pokémon that resembles a splash of milk. It has a droplet-shaped body composed of cream, with two arms and a crown of six protrusions. These protrusions are made out of that same cream with droplets constantly jumping from them. It has completely white eyes.

Milcery is born from sweet-smelling particles in the air. When a Milcery absorbs sweet aromas, its body begins to swell. Milcery will start to deflate when its energy level begins to drop. When Milcery is attacked, it will tackle the foe first before covering them in cream. Once the opponent is either blinded or astonished by delicious cream, Milcery will then flee. It is rumored that patisseries visited by Milcery are guaranteed success and good fortune. It is a female-only species.

Evolution

Milcery evolves into one of nine forms of Alcremie.

(For specifics on this Pokémon's Evolution in the games, refer to Game data→Evolution data.)

Unevolved
Milcery
 Fairy 

→
First Evolution
Alcremie
 Fairy 

Alcremie's flavor and color are wildly variable and dependent on the time of day, slight vibrations, direction, and duration for which it was swirled while it was a Milcery.

Vanilla Cream Ruby Cream Matcha Cream Mint Cream Lemon Cream Salted Cream Ruby Swirl Caramel Swirl Rainbow Swirl
Each form has seven further minor forms.
For more details on Alcremie's appearance, see its forms section

Evolution data

Milcery evolves into Alcremie while holding a Sweet when the player spins and strikes a pose (in Pokémon Sword and Shield) or gets dizzy (in Pokémon Scarlet and Violet). The form it evolves into depends on the time of day, the length of the spin, and whether the Trainer was spinning clockwise or counterclockwise. Its appearance is further determined by the type of Sweet that is held.

Milcery evolves into:

  • Vanilla Cream Alcremie after spinning clockwise for less than 5 seconds during the day.
  • Ruby Cream Alcremie after spinning counterclockwise for less than 5 seconds during the day.
  • Matcha Cream Alcremie after spinning clockwise for less than 5 seconds at night.
  • Mint Cream Alcremie after spinning counterclockwise for more than 5 seconds at night.
  • Lemon Cream Alcremie after spinning clockwise for more than 5 seconds at night.
  • Salted Cream Alcremie after spinning counterclockwise for less than 5 seconds at night.
  • Ruby Swirl Alcremie after spinning counterclockwise for more than 5 seconds during the day.
  • Caramel Swirl Alcremie after spinning clockwise for more than 5 seconds during the day.
  • Rainbow Swirl Alcremie after spinning in either direction for more than 10 seconds during the evening (between 7:00 and 7:59PM in real time in Pokémon Sword and Shield).

Milcery

Each form has seven further minor forms based on the Sweet used to evolve it.
For more details on Alcremie's appearance, see its forms section

Sprites

Generation VIII

Cross-Generation

For other sprites and images, please see Milcery images on the Bulbagarden Archives.


In animation

Main series

Major appearances

Murdock's Milcery

Murdock's Alcremie appeared as a Milcery in The Bittersweet Truth in a flashback where she was shown evolving.

Other

Milcery debuted in The Sweet Taste of Battle!, where one was caught by Goh. She evolved into a Vanilla Cream Alcremie almost immediately afterwards when he placed a Strawberry Sweet on her and spun her around.

Minor appearances

Pokédex entries

Episode Pokémon Source Entry
JN082 Milcery Goh's Rotom Phone Milcery, the Cream Pokémon. A Fairy type. Milcery's body is made of cream, cream that forms when sweet-smelling particles travel on the wind and gather together.

Pokémon: Twilight Wings

A Milcery appeared in Early-Evening Waves, under the ownership of a Café Master. She and an Alcremie assisted him in the Battle Café.

In the manga

Pokémon Adventures

A Dynamaxed Milcery appeared in Shock!! Chairman Rose's Plan during the Darkest Day.

In the TCG

Main article: Milcery (TCG)

Trivia

Origin

Milcery appears to be based on a drop of milk or a blob of cream.

Name origin

Milcery may be a combination of milk and sorcery.

Mahomil may be a combination of 魔法 mahō (magic) and milk.

In other languages

Language Title Meaning
Japanese マホミル Mahomil From 魔法 mahō and milk
French Crèmy From crème Chantilly and baby
Spanish Milcery Same as English name
German Hokumil From Hokuspokus and Milch
Italian Milcery Same as English name
